judgement_sentence: The Sparse Hamiltonian Flows (SHF) clearly and strongly outperform the alternatives in most experiments.
sentiment_expression: clearly and strongly outperform the alternatives in most experiments

judgement_sentence: The paper is very well-written and clear.
The suggested combination of methods clearly and strongly improves performance compared to the alternatives.
sentiment_expression: clearly and strongly improves performance compared to the alternatives

judgement_sentence: The paper provides a theoretical analysis of why and in which manner the performance improves due to SHF.
sentiment_expression: provides a theoretical analysis of why and in which manner the performance improves due to SHF

judgement_sentence: The experiments are all in fairly simple settings.
sentiment_expression: are all in fairly simple settings

judgement_sentence: I think, the limitations of the method were discussed insufficiently and should be addressed as described in questions 1 and 2.
In its current form, the paper convinces me that SHF decreases runtime and increases performance for datasets with low complexity.
sentiment_expression: convinces me that SHF decreases runtime and increases performance for datasets with low complexity

judgement_sentence: The assumptions that SHF makes and the implied limitations are underexplored.
content_expression: The assumptions that SHF makes and the implied limitations
